content:
That's a great approach to weathering and aging! Using a combination of washes and drybrushing can create a very realistic worn look, and adding pigments can give it an extra layer of depth and realism. Washes are great for creating subtle, nuanced shading and color variations, while drybrushing can add a more textured, worn look to raised surfaces. Pigments can be used to add subtle dirt and grime effects, and can be blended to create a very realistic look.

It's great that you attended a local model building club meetup! Meeting fellow enthusiasts and seeing their work can be incredibly inspiring and motivating. It's amazing how much talent and expertise is out there, and it's always exciting to see what others are working on.

That WWII-era bomber model sounds incredible! It's great that it motivated you to push yourself to add more complexity to your own models. Sometimes, seeing what others are capable of can spark new ideas and inspiration, and it's awesome that you're feeling motivated to take your skills to the next level.

What specific areas of your Ferrari model do you think you'll focus on adding more complexity to? Are you thinking of adding more details to the engine, interior, or exterior?

Also, did you learn any new techniques or tips from the meetup that you're excited to try out on your current project?
